poem:
The Fast Track  

From the back of darkened lorries,  
or small boats skimming the slate sea,  
they arrive—a human blur—  
only to be sent spinning  
back across the globe,  
bureaucrats sharpening pencils  
as if carving their own initials  
into the skin of a country  
that might have been a home,  
but now is only a door.
